meanings.sent1: The family decided to presettle in the new town before moving.
meanings.sent2: She presettled the arrangements for the event to avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent3: The idea of presettling the picnic location led to a comical mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His decision to presettle his debts helped him avoid financial troubles later on.
meanings.sent5: Presettling the rules early on made the game run smoothly.

meanings.definition: The act of settling or establishing beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The presettling of the terms ensured a smooth negotiation process.
meanings.sent2: Presettling is important in project planning to avoid delays.
meanings.sent3: The presettling of the seating arrangement caused some confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her presettling of the schedule allowed for a stress-free vacation.
meanings.sent5: The presettling of the agreement saved time and effort in the long run.
